headline.main: STUDY SHOWS EFFECTS OF CIGARETTE SMOKE ON THE NONSMOKER

docs.lead_paragraph: A nonsmoker in a family in which more than two packs of cigarettes are smoked each day actually inhales smoke the equivalent to that of one or two cigarettes, a Japanese study shows. The researchers used a urine test to estimate the amount of smoke inhaled by nonsmokers on the job and at home. In general, they found that the smokier the environment, the more smoke these nonsmokers took in.
